issues.title: [BIZ] Create AI Academy Certification & Credentialing Program
issues.description:
## Opportunity: AI Academy Official Certification

Launch official certification program for Academy graduates to add credibility and increase perceived value.

## Certification Levels

### Level 1: AI Automation Certified (AC-1)

* Completion of Academy L1 curriculum
* Pass practical assessment (build 5 AI workflows)
* Certificate of completion + digital badge
* Verification URL for employers/clients
* Exam fee: €49 (included in Academy L1 Premium)

### Level 2: AI Professional Certified (AC-2)

* Completion of Academy L2 curriculum
* Practical project submission (real-world use case)
* Peer review + trainer assessment
* LinkedIn certification badge
* Exam fee: €99

### Level 3: AI Orchestrator Certified (AC-3)

* Completion of Academy L3 curriculum
* Capstone project (solve complex business problem)
* Live presentation to instructors
* Industry panel review
* Exam fee: €199
* Includes: Letter of recommendation, portfolio showcase

### Master Certification: AI Expert (AC-Master)

* All 3 levels completed
* 6 months of practical application
* Contribution to AI community (case study, tutorial, or talk)
* Exam fee: €499
* Lifetime certification + annual renewal

## Value Proposition

**For Students:**

* Credible credential for career advancement
* Differentiation in job market
* Verification for employers/clients
* Resume and LinkedIn badge
* Confidence in skills

**For Employers:**

* Pre-vetted AI talent pool
* Standardized skill assessment
* Reduced hiring risk
* Training ROI validation

## Competitive Landscape

* Coursera: Certificates (free with course, no assessment)
* Udemy: Certificates of completion (no verification)
* Google AI Certificate: Free, no assessment
* Our Advantage: Practical assessment + industry validation

## Revenue Streams

1. **Exam fees** (€49-499 per student)
2. **Certification prep courses** (€199-299 intensive workshops)
3. **Recertification** (€99 every 2 years)
4. **Employer verification API** (€500-1,500/year per company)
5. **Certified talent marketplace** (commission on hires)

## Revenue Potential

* 100 Academy L1 students/month × 50% take certification = 50 × €49 = €2,450/mo
* 30 Academy L2 students/month × 40% take certification = 12 × €99 = €1,188/mo
* 10 Academy L3 students/month × 30% take certification = 3 × €199 = €597/mo
* 5 Master certifications/year = 5 × €499 = €2,495/year
* **Monthly revenue:** \~€4,235 (€50K/year)

## Upsell Opportunities

* Certification students more likely to buy corporate training
* Certified graduates become brand advocates (referrals)
* Employers hiring certified talent → more Academy sales
* Certification prep workshops → additional revenue

## Implementation Requirements

1. Certification assessment platform (quiz, practical project submission)
2. Certificate generation system (PDF + digital badge)
3. Verification portal for employers
4. Certification curriculum and rubrics
5. Reviewer/instructor onboarding
6. Certification marketing materials

## Next Steps

1. Define AC-1 assessment criteria (5 practical workflows)
2. Create certificate design and digital badge
3. Build verification portal
4. Pilot with 20 Academy L1 students (December 2025)
5. Launch AC-1 January 2026
6. Design AC-2 and AC-3 assessments (February 2026)

## Success Metrics

* 50 certification registrations in January 2026
* 40% certification pass rate (shows quality)
* 5 employers verify certifications in Q1 2026
* €4K+ monthly certification revenue by March 2026
* 10% premium pricing for certified graduates (freelancers/consultants can charge more)

issues.title: [BIZ] Launch AI Academy Affiliate Partner Program
issues.description:
## Opportunity: Academy Affiliate Marketing

Launch affiliate program to scale Academy enrollments through partners who already have audiences interested in AI education.

## Partner Categories

### Marketing & Business Influencers (50-500K followers)

* Content creators in AI, productivity, business
* Tech bloggers and newsletter writers
* LinkedIn thought leaders
* Commission: 25-30% of Academy sales (€12-30 per €49-99 sale)

### Training Providers & Agencies

* Companies offering marketing/sales/business training
* Can upsell AI Academy as add-on
* Commission: 35-40% (bulk sales)
* Minimum: 5 students/month to maintain partner status

### Polish Media & Publishers

* Tech/business publications in Poland
* Can promote Polish Academy launch
* Commission: 30%
* Bonus: 10% extra for first 3 months

### HR Tech Platforms & Communities

* HR tech companies (HR communities, recruitment platforms)
* Can promote corporate training packages
* Commission: 20% of corporate sales (€200-1,000 per €1-5K sale)

## Commission Structure

| Partner Tier | Sales/Month | Commission | Requirements |
| -- | -- | -- | -- |
| Starter | 0-10 sales | 20% | Sign up + 1 active promotion |
| Bronze | 11-50 sales | 25% | Monthly newsletter |
| Silver | 51-200 sales | 30% | Dedicated landing page |
| Gold | 200+ sales | 35% | Custom co-branded content |

## Platform Requirements

1. Partner signup portal
2. Unique tracking links for each partner
3. Real-time dashboard (sales, clicks, conversions)
4. Monthly payouts via Stripe or bank transfer
5. Marketing assets ready (banners, email templates, social posts)

## Revenue Impact

* If 50 partners each drive 5 sales/month: 250 sales × €79 avg = €19,750/mo gross
* Affiliate payout (25% avg): €4,938/mo
* Net revenue: €14,812/mo (\~€178K/year)
* Upsell opportunity: 20% of affiliate sales convert to L2-4 Academy (€199-1500)

## Competitive Benchmark

* Udemy Affiliate Program: 10-50% commission
* Coursera Partners: 15-30% commission
* Our 20-35% is competitive with better product differentiation

## Marketing to Recruit Partners

1. Cold outreach to 100 AI/business influencers
2. Partner with marketing agencies as white-label Academy resellers
3. Promote on LinkedIn (target "affiliate marketing", "content creator")
4. Attend AI/marketing conferences
5. Offer exclusive bonuses for early partners (double commission first month)

## Next Steps

1. Define affiliate commission tiers
2. Build partner signup portal (or use existing referral VD-496 infrastructure)
3. Create partner marketing kit (banners, email templates, social posts)
4. Recruit 20 pilot partners
5. Launch affiliate program January 15, 2026

## Success Metrics

* 50 active partners by March 2026
* 250 Academy sales/month through affiliates
* €15K+ net monthly revenue from affiliate channel
* 10% of total Academy revenue from affiliates
* €500+ average partner monthly payout (shows healthy ecosystem)

issues.title: [BIZ] Create AI Academy Corporate Training Packages (B2B)
issues.description:
## Opportunity: Corporate AI Training Academy

Offer AI Academy as corporate training for teams (not just individuals). Companies need to upskill their workforce quickly and consistently.

## Market Opportunity

* 63% of Czech IT companies struggle to find AI talent (from market research)
* Companies prefer bulk training vs individual subscriptions
* Budget available: €1,000-10,000 per training engagement
* Training ROI: 16× productivity gain (our case study)

## Product Offerings

### Team License (10-50 employees)

* Academy L1 access for entire team
* Dedicated trainer sessions (4 hours Q&A)
* Team-specific use cases and exercises
* Progress dashboard for manager
* Pricing: €999-2,999 (€100-60/person)

### Corporate Bootcamp (1-2 days)

* In-person or virtual intensive training
* Hands-on workshop with company-specific scenarios
* Custom prompt library for company workflows
* Train-the-trainer session for internal champions
* Pricing: €2,500-5,000/day

### Academy Enterprise Subscription (50+ employees)

* Unlimited Academy access for all employees
* Monthly office hours with trainer
* New course modules included automatically
* Custom learning paths per department
* Usage analytics and ROI reporting
* Pricing: €500-1,500/month

## Target Industries

1. **Marketing Agencies**: Already using AI, need team-wide training (€2-5K/bootcamp)
2. **SaaS Companies**: Product teams need AI upskilling (€999-2,999/team)
3. **Startups (Seed+)**: Budget for team training, fast adoption (€1-2,999/bootcamp)
4. **Traditional Companies** (Manufacturing, Finance, Retail): Large workforces, AI transformation (Enterprise subscriptions)

## Sales Strategy

1. Cold outreach to HR Directors and L&D Managers
2. Partner with training providers (white-label our content)
3. Upsell from existing Sense Audit customers
4. LinkedIn posts targeting "AI upskilling"
5. Free 1-hour demo workshop → paid engagement

## Competitive Advantage

* **Orchestration methodology** (not just prompting) differentiates from generic AI courses
* **Native Czech language** training (competitors: English only)
* **16× productivity case study** (proof of ROI)
* **Customizable** for company-specific workflows

## Revenue Potential (Q1-Q2 2026)

* 5 Team Licenses (€999-2,999) = €5-15K
* 3 Corporate Bootcamps (€2,500-5,000/day) = €7.5-15K
* 2 Enterprise Subscriptions (€500-1,500/month) = €1-3K/month
* **Total Q1:** \~€22K revenue
* **Q2 recurring:** €2-3K/month from enterprise subscriptions

## Requirements

1. Corporate training curriculum (team exercises, case studies)
2. Trainer materials (slide decks, workshop guides)
3. Pricing page for corporate offerings
4. CRM templates for B2B sales
5. Case study from corporate client

## Next Steps

1. Define Team License pricing and deliverables
2. Create Corporate Bootcamp curriculum outline
3. Draft Enterprise subscription features
4. Build corporate pricing page
5. Reach out to 20 HR Directors for discovery calls

## Success Metrics

* 5 corporate clients by March 2026
* €20K+ revenue in Q1 2026
* €2K+ MRR by Q2 2026
* 100+ employees trained through corporate packages
* Case study published

issues.title: [BIZ] Expand AI Academy to Poland Market (€6.3M Year 1 Potential)
issues.description:
## Opportunity: Poland AI Academy Market Entry

Poland has 6× higher revenue potential than Czech (€6.325M vs €1.035M Year 1), lower competition, and 1B PLN government AI investment. Freemium model essential to compete with Microsoft's FREE training.

## Market Analysis

* Population: 38M (3.6× Czech Republic)
* AI Adoption: 5.9% (2nd lowest in EU) = massive untapped market
* Government: 1B PLN AI investment, Polish LLM launched Feb 2025
* Competition: Lower than CZ, but Microsoft FREE training is biggest threat

## Competitive Threat: Microsoft AI Skills Navigator

* Commitment: 1 million Poles trained by end of 2025
* Offering: 200+ FREE courses
* Threat: Can't compete on price alone

## Our Advantage: Freemium with Polish Specialization

* Basic: FREE (compete with Microsoft)
* Professional: 500 PLN/month (\~€125)
* Corporate: Custom pricing
* USP: Industry-specific + Polish language + certification + job placement

## Market Entry Strategy

### Phase 1 (January-February 2026)

* Launch freemium Academy in Polish
* Target SMEs (25% already using AI but need help)
* Focus on manufacturing (47% adoption) and finance (40%)
* Government partnership outreach

### Phase 2 (March-May 2026)

* Launch Advisory services in Polish
* 30 consulting engagements targeted
* Certification program launch

### Phase 3 (June+ 2026)

* Launch Labs implementation services
* Platform launch with Polish LLM integration

## Revenue Projection (Year 1)

From research analysis:

* Individual: 5,000 × 500 PLN × 6 mo = 15M PLN (\~€3.75M)
* Corporate: 50 × 50K PLN = 2.5M PLN (\~€625K)
* Advisory: 30 × 100K PLN = 3M PLN (\~€750K)
* Labs: 15 × 300K PLN = 4.5M PLN (\~€1.125M)
* Platform: 100 × 3K PLN/year = 300K PLN (\~€75K)
* **Total Year 1:** \~25.3M PLN (\~€6.325M)

## Estimated Impact (Conservative Q1 2026)

* 1,000 Polish individual signups at 10% paid conversion = 100 × €125 = €12,500
* 5 corporate workshops × 50K PLN = 250K PLN (\~€62,500)
* **Total Q1:** \~€75K revenue

## Requirements

1. Polish-speaking trainers (3-5)
2. Polish website and marketing materials
3. Polish-language curriculum
4. Government partnerships
5. Competitive freemium model

## Next Steps

1. Hire 1-2 Polish trainers (January Week 1-2)
2. Translate core curriculum to Polish (January Week 2-3)
3. Build Polish-language landing page (January Week 3)
4. Reach out to Polish government AI initiatives (January Week 4)
5. Launch pre-registration campaign (February Week 1)
6. Launch March 1, 2026

## Success Metrics

* 1,000 Polish individual users by March
* 5 corporate clients by March
* €75K+ Poland revenue in Q1
* Polish government partnership discussions initiated
* 3 Polish trainers hired

issues.title: [BIZ] Launch AI Academy + Sense Audit Bundle Offer
issues.description:
## Opportunity: Cross-sell Academy with Audit

Bundle Academy L1 (€49-99) with Sense Audit (€500) at discounted €449-499 (€100-150 savings vs separate €549-599 purchase).

## Why This Works

1. Academy teaches AI fundamentals, audit shows ROI gap
2. Audit customers need training to implement findings
3. Academy graduates want to audit their business
4. Natural upsell/cross-sell flow

## Marketing Strategy

* Position audit as "AI Readiness Assessment" for Academy students
* Position Academy as "Implementation Roadmap" for audit customers
* Bundle pricing creates urgency (limited time offer)
* Showcase case studies: audit findings → Academy solutions

## Pricing

* Separately: Academy L1 (€49) + Sense Audit (€500) = €549
* Bundle: €449 (€100 savings, 18% discount)
* Premium bundle: Academy L1 (€99) + Sense Audit (€500) = €599
* Premium bundle price: €499 (€100 savings, 17% discount)

## Revenue Potential

* Conservatively: 20% of audit customers buy Academy (50 audits x 20% x €49-99 = €490-990/mo)
* Conservatively: 30% of Academy students buy audit (100 students x 30% x €500 = €15K one-time)
* Upsell opportunity: Academy L2-4 (€199-1500) for engaged students

## Next Steps

1. Create bundle landing page
2. Update Stripe payment links for bundle pricing
3. Add bundle to Academy L1 checkout flow
4. Add Academy promo to audit report conclusion
5. Create bundle marketing materials (email, LinkedIn)

## Success Metrics

* Bundle conversion rate: Aim for 15-20% of audit/Academy customers
* Bundle revenue: Target €5K/mo by Q2 2026
* Student progression: 25% of bundle buyers upgrade to Academy L2-4

issues.title: [BIZ] Launch Q1 2026 New Year Revenue Campaign
issues.description:
## Context

ME-90 deadline is March 1, 2026 (EUR 3-5K MRR target).
Week 4 ending, need specific January kick-off campaign.

## Revenue Impact

* Creates urgency for early Q1 sales
* Time-limited offers can accelerate decisions
* Targets: SenseIt audits, Magic Box trials, Academy signups

## Campaign Ideas

1. "AI Readiness Check" promo - First 5 audits at EUR 399 (vs EUR 500)
2. Magic Box 30-day free trial for January signups
3. Academy L1 early bird pricing
4. New Year's resolution: "Automate your 2026"

## Action Required

1. Pick 1-2 campaign angles
2. Create time-limited landing page variants
3. Schedule LinkedIn posts for January 1-15
4. Set up tracking

## Priority

HIGH - Time-sensitive for January revenue.

issues.title: [BIZ] Collect First Customer Testimonials for SenseIt and TL;DR
issues.description:
## Context

Both Telegram bots are live but have no customer testimonials or reviews.
No social proof for marketing.

## Revenue Impact

* Testimonials increase conversion rates 30-50%
* Required for credible sales materials
* Enables case study creation (already has Linear issue)

## Action Required

1. Reach out to any existing bot users
2. Request short testimonial (1-3 sentences)
3. Get permission to use name/company
4. Add to landing pages

## Bots Available

* @sumarium_bot (TL;DR)
* @senseit_ai_bot (SenseIt)

## Priority

MEDIUM - Builds credibility for ongoing sales.

issues.title: [Strategy] Evaluate Kraliki evolution to decision SoR
issues.description:
## Context

Strategic question from research: Could Kraliki evolve from "AI agent orchestration" to "system of record for AI decisions"?

## Implications

* Context graph becomes audit trail for AI governance
* Training data for improving agent decisions
* Competitive moat (accumulated precedents are unique)
* Enterprise value ("why" more valuable than "what")

## Task

Evaluate:

1. Is this strategically desirable for Verduona?
2. What would the evolution path look like?
3. Resource requirements
4. Go-to-market implications

## Reference

See: `/github/brain-2026/decisions/2025-12-27-context-graphs-research.md`

## Deliverable

Strategy memo with recommendation.

issues.title: [Research] Study PlayerZero, Regie, Maximor architectures
issues.description:
## Context

These startups are exemplars of the three paths for building context graphs:

1. **Regie** - Replace SoR (AI-native sales engagement)
2. **Maximor** - Replace modules (finance workflows without replacing GL)
3. **PlayerZero** - New SoR (production engineering at glue function intersection)

## Task

Research their:

* Architecture approaches
* How they capture decision traces
* What makes them defensible
* Lessons applicable to Kraliki

## Reference

See: `/github/ai-automation/know-how/research/context-graphs-trillion-dollar-opportunity.md`

## Deliverable

Competitive analysis document with architectural learnings.

issues.title: [Research] Map exception logic in Verduona workflows
issues.description:
## Context

Context Graphs research identifies "exception logic in people's heads" as a key missing layer.

## Task

Identify exception patterns in our current apps:

* Focus by Kraliki: Task prioritization exceptions
* Voice by Kraliki: Call routing overrides
* Pulse by Kraliki: Survey logic exceptions
* Business decisions that bypass standard flows

## Reference

See: `/github/brain-2026/decisions/2025-12-27-context-graphs-research.md`

## Deliverable

Document of exception patterns that could be captured as decision traces.

issues.title: E2E Test: Kraliki Dashboard /see route
issues.description:
Test the new /see visualization route on Kraliki dashboard.

## Test URL

[https://swarm.verduona.dev/see](https://swarm.verduona.dev/see)

(Alternative: [https://gin.verduona.dev/see](https://gin.verduona.dev/see) - both work)

## Test Steps

1. Navigate to [https://swarm.verduona.dev/see](https://swarm.verduona.dev/see)
2. Verify project selector works (Kraliki, Focus, Pulse, Voice, Learn, Lab)
3. Check Mermaid diagram renders correctly
4. Verify live agent status shows correctly
5. Test refresh button
6. Screenshot the page

## Expected

* Interactive architecture diagram visible
* Agent status badges with correct colors
* Project switching works

Created by Kraliki swarm.

issues.title: [BIZ] Create Case Study Package for SenseIt Audits
issues.description:
**Opportunity:** Convert €500 audits into €3K+ retainers through documented success stories.

**Problem:** Trust barrier with new clients. Need proof of ROI.

**Solution:** Create compelling case study package:

1. Before/After metrics (time saved, costs reduced, revenue increased)
2. Client testimonials (video + written)
3. Implementation timeline
4. ROI calculator specific to audit findings

**Format:** PDF + landing page + social media assets

**Success Metrics:**

* 30% audit-to-retainer conversion rate
* 5 case studies by Q2 2026

**Estimated Impact:** €2-3K MRR (1-2 retained clients/month @ €2,500)

issues.title: [BIZ] Develop Industry-Specific AI Training Tracks
issues.description:
**Opportunity:** Most competitors offer generic AI training. Verduona can dominate niche markets with industry-specific content.

**Target Industries:**

1. **Healthcare** - AI Act compliance, medical AI applications
2. **Finance** - Fraud detection, algorithmic trading, risk assessment
3. **Manufacturing** - Predictive maintenance, quality control, supply chain
4. **E-commerce** - Customer service automation, inventory optimization

**Market Gap:** Current offerings (Datascript, NaučímeAI, Digitáři) are generic.

**Competitive Advantage:**

* Vertical integration (training → implementation → platform)
* Pre-trained teams from Academy feed into Labs
* Real case studies from implementation projects

**Pricing:** €499-999 per specialized track
**Timeline:** Q3 2026 launch

**Estimated Impact:** €5-10K MRR (10-20 clients @ €500/month)

issues.title: [BIZ] Create AI Fundamentals Course for Beginners
issues.description:
**Opportunity:** [fast.ai](http://fast.ai) and [deepLearning.AI](http://deepLearning.AI) offer FREE courses, but Verduona can differentiate with practical, business-focused content.

**Competitor Analysis:**

* Coursera ML Specialization: 4 courses, €171/year, intermediate level
* [fast.ai](http://fast.ai): FREE, code-first, practical deep learning
* [deepLearning.AI](http://deepLearning.AI): FREE resources, paid certifications

**Verduona Differentiation:**

* Focus on immediate business ROI
* Czech/Slovak language support
* Industry-specific use cases
* Integration with Verduona products (SenseIt, Magic Box)

**Pricing:** €49-99 (competitive to Coursera's €171/year)
**Target:** Developers, managers, business owners
**Format:** 6-week online course, 2 hours/week

**Estimated Impact:** €1-2K MRR (20-40 students @ €50/course/month)

issues.title: [BIZ] Launch AI Academy for Corporate Training in Czech/Poland
issues.description:
**Opportunity:** 600K workers in Czech Republic need AI retraining by 2030. Poland has 1B PLN government AI investment.

**Market Research:**

* Coursera: €171/year for Coursera Plus, 495K+ learners in ML specialization
* [fast.ai](http://fast.ai): FREE practical courses, strong community
* [deepLearning.AI](http://deepLearning.AI): 7M+ learners, Andrew Ng's platform

**Pricing Strategy:**

* Compete with Datascript: 2,614 CZK (\~€115) for 2-day workshop
* Verduona advantage: Industry-specific + implementation path
* Target: €49-99 per course (competitive to €171 Coursera)

**Next Steps:**

1. Create 3 core courses: AI Fundamentals, Prompt Engineering, Industry Implementation
2. Target healthcare, finance, manufacturing sectors
3. Launch beta in Q2 2026
4. Use existing 50K+ words of Czech AI education research as foundation

**Estimated Impact:** €3-5K MRR (10-20 students at €250-500/course)

issues.title: [DNS] Update *.verduona.dev to production 138.201.54.142
issues.description:
## URGENT: DNS Update Required

**Current:** \*.verduona.dev → 5.9.38.218 (dev)
**Required:** \*.verduona.dev → 138.201.54.142 (prod)

### Instructions

1. Log into Namecheap for verduona.dev
2. Update wildcard A record
3. Verify: dig focus.verduona.dev +short

### Impact

SSL certificates cannot be issued until DNS points to production.

issues.title: [BIZ] Offer AI-First Government Consulting
issues.description: Provide AI consulting for EU governments/public sector. Market: $8.2B public sector AI consulting (2026). EU has €100B+ AI spending mandates (Digital Europe Programme). Services: AI Readiness Assessment (€10K-20K) - tech stack readiness, gap analysis vs EU AI Act, implementation roadmap. AI Implementation Project (€30K-50K) - AI chatbots for citizen services, document processing automation, AI-powered analytics, staff training. Target: Municipalalities (local services), National Agencies (regulatory compliance), EU Commission (cross-border AI services). Revenue potential: €115,000 by Q1 2027. Advantage: EU data sovereignty (Hetzner EU data centers) + practical implementation. Register as EU supplier (TED e-procurement), submit Digital Europe tenders. See brain-2026/BIZ-DISCOVERY-REPORT-DEC26-SESSION2.md #Opportunity8.

issues.title: [BIZ] Build WordPress AI Content Plugin
issues.description: Integrate Magic Box as WordPress plugin for one-click AI content generation. Market: 43% of websites use WordPress (60M+ sites). Features: Blog Post Generator (SEO-optimized from keywords), Auto-Publishing, AI Image Generation, Multi-language localization. Pricing: Starter €19/month (20 posts), Growth €29/month (100 posts), Pro €49/month (unlimited + priority). Revenue potential: €42,000/month by Q4 2026. Implementation: Build WordPress plugin (PHP, REST API), integrate Magic Box API, submit to WordPress Plugin Directory (free traffic), partner with WordPress agencies. See brain-2026/BIZ-DISCOVERY-REPORT-DEC26-SESSION2.md #Opportunity7.

issues.title: [BIZ] Offer AI-First Startup Advisory
issues.description: Provide AI-native business model consulting for startups (not just AI tool recommendations). Market: $15B startup consulting market (2025). Startups build AI wrappers, not AI-native products. Services: AI strategy advisory (€3K-5K), opportunity assessment, competitive analysis, GTM strategy, technical feasibility. Ongoing advisory: €1K-3K/month (weekly strategy calls, roadmap guidance, access to our AI infrastructure). Target: Seed-stage startups ($500K-2M raised), pre-seed founders validating AI ideas, corporate spinouts. Revenue potential: €33,000 by Q3 2026. Create 'AI-Native Startup Playbook' with case studies. See brain-2026/BIZ-DISCOVERY-REPORT-DEC26-SESSION2.md #Opportunity5.

issues.title: [BIZ] Offer AI Ethics Consulting for Enterprises
issues.description: Provide AI ethics consulting with practical implementation (not just theory). Market: $2.5B AI ethics & governance market (2026). Companies concerned about AI bias, privacy, transparency. Services: AI bias assessment (€5K-10K), privacy/GDPR compliance review, transparency audit, implementation advisory (€2K-5K/month). Target: Financial Services (AI lending, fraud detection), Healthcare (diagnostic AI, HIPAA), HR Tech (AI hiring, bias), Government (public-facing AI). Revenue potential: €52,500 by Q4 2026. Differentiation: We build AI systems (deep technical knowledge), not just consultants. See brain-2026/BIZ-DISCOVERY-REPORT-DEC26-SESSION2.md #Opportunity3.

issues.title: [BIZ] Build Shopify AI Content Plugin
issues.description: Integrate Magic Box as Shopify app for one-click AI content generation (product descriptions, blog posts, social media). Market: Shopify app store has 6,000+ apps, $1B+ revenue, 8M+ stores. Features: Product Description Generator, SEO Blog Posts, Social Media Content, Multi-language. Pricing: $29-99/month subscription. Revenue potential: $44,000/month (€40K+) by Q4 2026. Implementation: Build Shopify app (Node.js), submit to App Store (free distribution), cold outreach to top 1,000 merchants. See brain-2026/BIZ-DISCOVERY-REPORT-DEC26-SESSION2.md #Opportunity2.

issues.title: [BIZ] Launch AI Localization Services (Multi-Language Content)
issues.description: Offer AI-generated localization (50 languages) with cultural nuance checks. Market: $56B localization market (2025), growing 15% YoY. Most AI tools are English-first, creating gap for multilingual AI content. Pricing: €150-400/project or €500-2,000/month retainer. Target: SaaS scaling to EU/LATM/APAC, e-commerce localization, publishers. Revenue potential: €18,000 MRR by Q3 2026. Leverage Gemini 2.5 Flash multilingual capabilities + human quality control. See brain-2026/BIZ-DISCOVERY-REPORT-DEC26-SESSION2.md #Opportunity1.

issues.title: [mac-browser] Test: Screenshot kraliki.com and verify it loads
issues.description:
Browser automation test task.

## Instructions

1. Navigate to [https://kraliki.com](https://kraliki.com)
2. Wait for page to fully load
3. Take a screenshot
4. Report back:
   * Does the page load?
   * What do you see?
   * Any errors?

## Context

This domain was just pointed to production server 138.201.54.142 today.
Expected: Should show something (may be blank if no web server configured yet)

## Report format

Update this issue with your findings and attach screenshot if possible.

Revenue potential: €25,000 MRR by Q4 2026. Target: HR departments, L&D teams. See brain-2026/BIZ-DISCOVERY-REPORT-DEC26.md #Opportunity4.

Sell templates + customization services. Revenue potential: €50,000/month by Q4 2026. See brain-2026/BIZ-DISCOVERY-REPORT-DEC26.md #Opportunity3.

issues.title: [BIZ] AI Sales Intelligence & Pipeline Automation Service
issues.description:
## Opportunity

2026 mandate: Enterprises must "grow revenue without growing headcount." Revenue operations is top priority. Sells to revenue-generating departments (have budget). Direct ROI measurement (revenue increase).

## Market Context

* 2026 requirement: Aggressive revenue targets with last year's resources
* Sales teams seeking AI to exceed targets
* Revenue operations is #1 priority for CROs/CEOs
* AI adoption in sales teams: 85% (highest of all departments)

## Revenue Model

* Per-seat pricing: $100-$500/user/month
* Team licenses: $2,000-$10,000/month
* Enterprise: $20,000-$100,000/month
* Performance bonus: % of revenue increase
* Implementation: $10,000-$100,000

## Features That Sell

1. **Lead Scoring**: Prioritize hottest prospects automatically
2. **Next-Best-Action Recommendations**: AI suggests next steps
3. **Pipeline Forecasting**: Predict revenue with 80%+ accuracy
4. **Automated Outreach Sequences**: Multi-channel follow-up (email, LinkedIn, SMS)
5. **Deal Risk Analysis**: Identify stalled deals before they die
6. **Competitive Intelligence**: Track competitor activity
7. **CRM Integration**: Salesforce, HubSpot, EspoCRM

## Target Customers

* SaaS companies (20-200 employees, growth phase)
* Professional services firms (consulting, agencies)
* B2B companies with sales teams of 5-50 people
* High-ticket sales companies (consulting, enterprise software)

## Why This Sells Easily

1. Sells to revenue-generating departments (have budget, ROI obvious)
2. ROI = increased deal closure rates
3. Measurable: Can show pipeline improvement immediately
4. Integrates with existing CRMs (no switch required)
5. Sales managers desperate to hit 2026 targets

## Competitive Position

* Enterprise solutions: Expensive ($50K+/year), complex
* Point solutions: Only one feature (e.g., lead scoring)
* Our offering: Complete platform, affordable pricing, fast setup
* Tech leverage: AI agents + our CRM (EspoCRM) + integrations

## Implementation Plan

### Week 1-2: MVP Features

1. Lead scoring model (based on engagement, company data)
2. Next-best-action recommendations (AI-powered)
3. Basic pipeline forecasting

### Week 3-4: Advanced Features

4. Automated outreach sequences (email + LinkedIn)
5. Deal risk analysis (identify stalled deals)
6. CRM integrations (Salesforce, HubSpot, EspoCRM)

### Week 5-6: Enterprise Features

7. Competitive intelligence tracking
8. Multi-team collaboration
9. Analytics dashboard (win/loss analysis, funnel metrics)

## Estimated Impact

Conservative Q1 2026:

* 5 customers × $3,000/month = $15K MRR by March
* 5 implementations × $15,000 = $75K setup revenue
* **Total Q1:** $75K (setup) + $15K MRR

Aggressive Year 1:

* 50 customers × $5,000/month average = $250K MRR
* 50 implementations × $20,000 = $1M setup revenue
* **Year 1:** $1M + $3M ARR = $4M

## Pricing Strategy

* Starter (up to 10 users): $299/month
* Team (up to 50 users): $1,499/month
* Business (up to 100 users): $4,999/month
* Enterprise (unlimited): Custom ($10K-$50K/month)

## Next Steps

1. Define MVP feature set (Week 1 January)
2. Build lead scoring model (Week 2 January)
3. Create demo environment with sample data (Week 3 January)
4. Build sales deck (Week 3 January)
5. Create pricing calculator based on team size/features (Week 4 January)
6. LinkedIn outreach to SaaS founders/Sales VPs (February)
7. Launch with 3 beta customers at 50% discount

## Success Metrics

* MVP ready by end of January
* 3 beta customers by February
* 5 paying customers by March
* $15K MRR by March
* $75K setup revenue by March
* 10+ CRM integrations by March

## Upsell Opportunities

1. **AI Sales Training**: Train teams to use AI tools ($1K-$5K/workshop)
2. **Custom AI Agents**: Industry-specific sales agents (consulting)
3. **Marketing Automation**: Integrate outbound campaigns (add-on $500-$2K/month)
4. **Data Enrichment**: Company intelligence feeds (add-on $200-$1K/month)

issues.title: [BIZ] EU AI Act Compliance Assessment Service
issues.description:
## Opportunity

EU AI Act compliance market: $60B+ by 2026. Mandatory requirement (not optional). Companies rarely switch once integrated. Fear-based selling works (penalties for non-compliance).

## Market Context

* EU AI Act enforcement: From February 2, 2025
* Mandatory AI literacy requirements for all companies
* PwC Akademie already offering AI Act compliance training (competition)
* Penalties for non-compliance drive urgency

## Revenue Model

* Assessment subscription: $10,000-$100,000/year
* Per-regulation module: $2,000-$10,000
* Audit services: $5,000-$50,000/audit
* Ongoing monitoring: $1,000-$10,000/month

## Target Industries

* Financial services (heavily regulated, high urgency)
* Healthcare (HIPAA + GDPR + AI Act)
* Tech companies handling EU customer data
* Any company using AI in EU market

## Why This Sells Easily

1. Mandatory requirement (not optional)
2. Fear-based selling (penalties for non-compliance)
3. ROI = avoided fines + reduced audit costs
4. CFO/legal buy-in (not just IT)
5. Once integrated, rarely switch (high retention)

## Competitive Advantage

* Most competitors: Theory-heavy training (PwC, Deloitte)
* Our offering: Automated assessment + monitoring tool
* Tech-first approach (vs. consulting-heavy)
* EU presence (GDPR knowledge)
* Affordable for SMEs (vs. enterprise pricing)

## Service Offerings

1. **AI Compliance Assessment**: Scorecard of current AI systems
2. **Compliance Audit**: Deep-dive review of AI workflows
3. **Monitoring Dashboard**: Ongoing compliance status tracking
4. **Remediation Roadmap**: Step-by-step path to compliance
5. **Certification**: Official compliance certification

## Estimated Impact

Conservative Q1 2026:

* 10 assessments × $5,000 = $50K revenue
* 2 monitoring subscriptions × $2,000/month = $4K MRR

Aggressive Year 1:

* 50 assessments × $10,000 = $500K
* 20 monitoring subscriptions × $5,000/month = $100K MRR
* **Year 1:** $500K + $1.2M ARR = $1.7M

## Next Steps

1. Research EU AI Act requirements in detail (Week 1 January)
2. Build compliance assessment questionnaire (Week 2 January)
3. Create scoring rubric (0-100 compliance score) (Week 2-3 January)
4. Build assessment web app (Week 3-4 January)
5. Create pricing model based on company size/risk (Week 4 January)
6. LinkedIn outreach to EU companies using AI (February)
7. Partner with law firms for cross-selling

## Success Metrics

* Assessment tool live by February
* 10 completed assessments by March
* $50K+ revenue from assessments by March
* 2 monitoring subscriptions by March
* Partnership discussions with 2 law firms by March

issues.title: [BIZ] White-Label AI Customer Service Platform
issues.description:
## Opportunity

AI Customer Service & Support Automation: $11.8B market in 2026, growing to $27B by 2030. Contact centers projected to save $80B in labor costs by 2026. Easy to sell, immediate ROI.

## Market Opportunity

* Healthcare chatbot market alone: $543.65M in 2026
* 110.9 million chatbot users expected by 2026
* Real case: AI chatbot earning $25K/month with high margins
* Every business needs 24/7 support

## Revenue Model

* Per-ticket pricing: $0.50-$2.00 per conversation
* Subscription: $500-$5,000/month (tier by volume)
* Setup: $3,000-$25,000
* Enterprise: $10,000-$100,000/month

## Target Customers

* E-commerce companies (24/7 support needed)
* SaaS companies (technical support)
* Healthcare providers (appointment scheduling)
* Financial services (account inquiries)
* Real estate agencies (property questions)

## Why This Sells Easily

1. Immediate cost savings vs. human agents ($20-40/hour)
2. 24/7 availability
3. Scalable to handle volume spikes
4. Demo-able in real-time
5. Clear ROI calculation (labor cost ÷ per-conversation cost)

## Competitive Position

* Open-source alternatives: Difficult to deploy
* Enterprise solutions: Expensive ($100K+/year)
* Our offering: White-label, affordable, fast deployment
* Tech leverage: OpenAI/Anthropic APIs + our bot framework (TL;DR, SenseIt)

## Implementation Plan

1. White-label existing TL;DR and SenseIt bot tech
2. Build admin dashboard for clients to train/customize
3. Create multi-language support (Czech, Polish, English)
4. Integrate with existing CRMs (EspoCRM, Salesforce, HubSpot)
5. Build analytics dashboard (conversations, satisfaction, cost savings)

## Estimated Impact

Conservative Q1 2026:

* 5 customers × $2,000/month = $10K MRR by March
* 5 setups × $5,000 = $25K setup revenue
* **Total Q1:** $35K (setup) + $10K MRR

Aggressive Year 1:

* 50 customers × $3,000/month average = $150K MRR
* 50 setups × $10,000 = $500K setup revenue
* **Year 1:** $500K + $1.8M ARR = $2.3M

## Next Steps

1. Productize TL;DR and SenseIt tech as white-label solution (Week 1-2 January)
2. Build admin dashboard for client self-service (Week 2-3 January)
3. Create pricing calculator based on volume (Week 3 January)
4. Build sales deck and demo (Week 4 January)
5. LinkedIn outreach to SaaS/e-commerce founders (February)
6. Launch with 3 beta customers at 50% discount

## Success Metrics

* MVP ready by end of January
* 3 beta customers by February
* 5 paying customers by March
* $10K MRR by March
* $25K setup revenue by March

issues.title: [BIZ] Poland Market Entry with Freemium AI Education
issues.description:
## Opportunity

Poland has 6× higher revenue potential than Czech Republic ($6.325M vs. $1.035M Year 1), lower competition, and 1B PLN government AI investment. Freemium model essential to compete with Microsoft's FREE training.

## Market Analysis

* Population: 38M (3.6× Czech Republic)
* AI Adoption: 5.9% (2nd lowest in EU) = massive untapped market
* Government: 1B PLN AI investment, Polish LLM launched Feb 2025
* Competition: Lower than CZ, but Microsoft FREE training is biggest threat

## Competitive Threat: Microsoft AI Skills Navigator

* Commitment: 1 million Poles trained by end of 2025
* Offering: 200+ FREE courses
* Threat: Can't compete on price

## Our Advantage: Freemium with Polish Specialization

* Basic: FREE (compete with Microsoft)
* Professional: 500 PLN/month (\~$125)
* Corporate: Custom pricing
* USP: Industry-specific + Polish language + certification + job placement

## Market Entry Strategy

### Phase 1 (January-February 2026)

* Launch freemium Academy in Polish
* Target SMEs (25% already using AI but need help)
* Focus on manufacturing (47% adoption) and finance (40%)
* Government partnership outreach

### Phase 2 (March-May 2026)

* Launch Advisory services in Polish
* 30 consulting engagements targeted
* Certification program launch

### Phase 3 (June+ 2026)

* Launch Labs implementation services
* Platform launch with Polish LLM integration

## Revenue Projection (Year 1)

From research analysis:

* Individual: 5,000 × 500 PLN × 6 mo = 15M PLN (\~$3.75M)
* Corporate: 50 × 50K PLN = 2.5M PLN (\~$625K)
* Advisory: 30 × 100K PLN = 3M PLN (\~$750K)
* Labs: 15 × 300K PLN = 4.5M PLN (\~$1.125M)
* Platform: 100 × 3K PLN/year = 300K PLN (\~$75K)
* **Total Year 1:** \~25.3M PLN (\~$6.325M)

## Estimated Impact (Conservative Q1 2026)

* 1,000 individual signups at 10% paid conversion = 100 × $125 = $12,500
* 5 corporate workshops × 50K PLN = 250K PLN (\~$62,500)
* **Total Q1:** \~$75K revenue

## Requirements

1. Polish-speaking trainers (3-5)
2. Polish website and marketing materials
3. Polish-language curriculum
4. Government partnerships
5. Competitive freemium model

## Next Steps

1. Hire 1-2 Polish trainers (January Week 1-2)
2. Translate core curriculum to Polish (January Week 2-3)
3. Build Polish-language landing page (January Week 3)
4. Reach out to Polish government AI initiatives (January Week 4)
5. Launch pre-registration campaign (February Week 1)
6. Launch March 1, 2026

## Success Metrics

* 1,000 Polish individual users by March
* 5 corporate clients by March
* $75K+ Poland revenue in Q1
* Polish government partnership discussions initiated
* 3 Polish trainers hired

issues.title: [BIZ] Launch SME-Focused Fast-Track AI Implementation Service
issues.description:
## Opportunity

Market gap: All consultancies target enterprises (Deloitte, EY, McKinsey). SMEs are underserved, face long sales cycles (3-6 months), high prices (€100K+). Fast, affordable SME service can capture 600K Czech SMEs.

## Current Market

* Big 4: €100K-€500K projects, 3-6 month timelines
* Local players: Focus on enterprises, slow to deliver
* SME opportunity: 97% of EU businesses are SMEs
* Pain point: Can't afford enterprise consulting, need quick wins

## Our Offering: Fast-Track SME AI

* Scope: 2-4 week implementation sprints
* Pricing: €2K-€8K (vs. €50K+ for enterprise)
* Focus: Quick wins with measurable ROI
* Guarantee: Show ROI in 30 days or money back

## Target Customers

* Manufacturing SMEs (10-50 employees): Quality control automation
* E-commerce: Customer service bots, inventory management
* Financial services: Document processing, risk assessment
* Professional services: Marketing automation, proposal generation

## Implementation Playbooks

1. Week 1: Audit + Quick Win (1 workflow automated)
2. Week 2-3: Core Implementation (2-3 workflows)
3. Week 4: Training + Handoff
4. Ongoing: €500-€1,500/month support

## Estimated Impact

Conservative Q1 2026:

* 5 SME implementations × €4K = €20K revenue
* 2 retainers × €1K/month = €2K MRR

Aggressive Year 1:

* 30 implementations × €6K = €180K
* 10 retainers × €1K/month = €120K annual recurring

## Competitive Advantage

* 2-4 weeks vs. 3-6 months
* €4K vs. €50K+ pricing
* Pre-built solutions from R&D (Focus-Lite, CC-Lite, Magic Box)
* Post-implementation support option

## Next Steps

1. Define 3-4 standard implementation packages
2. Create pricing calculator based on company size/complexity
3. Build proposal templates
4. Create case study templates (theoretical to start)
5. LinkedIn outreach to SME founders/CTOs
6. Run 3 beta implementations at 50% discount for testimonials

## Success Metrics

* First SME client signed by February
* 5 implementations delivered by March
* €15K+ revenue from SME implementations by March
* First retainer signed by March
* 3 case studies created by April

issues.title: [BIZ] Build AI Readiness Assessment Tool for Lead Generation
issues.description:
## Opportunity

Detailed AI Readiness Test design exists (50K+ words research). Positioned as lead generation gold mine. Pricing: $5K-$50K for company assessments, $99-$499 for individual assessments.

## Current Status

* Design complete but NOT built
* Business test: 5-10 min web app testing processes, skills, leadership
* Human test: Skills, tools used, comfort with sales/ops
* Output: Score + diagnosis + recommended next step

## Revenue Projection (from research)

Year 1: $900K, Year 2: $3M from assessments alone
Conservative Q1 2026: 20 company assessments × $2,500 = $50K
Realistic: 50 assessments × $2,500 = $125K

## Market Gap

* No automated AI readiness tests in CZ/PL market
* Competitors offer manual consulting (slower, more expensive)
* Free basic assessment can generate leads, premium deep-dive upsells

## Implementation Plan

1. Build web app with assessment questions
2. Calculate scores (0-100 for companies and individuals)
3. Generate diagnosis reports
4. Recommend next steps (Audit/Training/AI Sales)
5. Capture leads to EspoCRM
6. Offer freemium: basic score (free), deep-dive ($99-$299)

## Estimated Impact

* Immediate: Lead generation for consultancy pipeline
* Q1 2026: 100+ free assessments = 20+ qualified leads
* Revenue: $10K-30K from premium assessments
* Upsell: 20% conversion to €5K-€25K audits = €4K-€10K pipeline

## Next Steps

1. Build Business AI Readiness Test web app (Week 1-2 January)
2. Build Human AI Readiness Test (Week 2-3 January)
3. Integrate with EspoCRM for lead capture
4. Create freemium pricing model
5. Test with network contacts, refine based on feedback
6. Launch on education landing page

## Success Metrics

* Both tests live by end of January
* 100+ assessments completed in February
* 20+ qualified leads generated
* $10K+ revenue from premium assessments
* 5%+ conversion rate to consultancy

issues.title: [BIZ] Partner Program Integration: Pleo, Make.com, Deel
issues.description:
## Opportunity

Consultancy services (AI Impact Audit €5K-€25K, Implementation €10K-€50K) need tool deployment. Partner programs provide 10-30% commissions on recurring revenue + setup fees.

## Current Status

* Partner programs NOT joined yet
* No recurring commission revenue
* Missing credibility boost from partner badges

## Partner Opportunities

### 1\. Pleo (Expense Management)

* Benefits: 20-30% first-year commission + setup fee
* Market: 80,000+ businesses using Pleo
* Fit: Expense automation is top priority for SMEs
* Effort: Application 1-2 days, approval 1-4 weeks

### 2\. [Make.com](http://Make.com) (Automation Platform)

* Benefits: Certified Partner status + setup fees + monthly management
* Market: 500,000+ organizations using Make
* Fit: Core to AI automation implementation
* Effort: Application 1-2 days, certification 3-5 days

### 3\. Deel (Global HR & Payroll)

* Benefits: $5-10K setup fee + 10-20% commission
* Market: 150,000+ businesses
* Fit: HR automation, global team management
* Effort: Application 1 day, approval 1-2 weeks

## Estimated Impact

Month 2-3: 3 Pleo deployments × €5K setup × 25% = €3,750
2 [Make.com](http://Make.com) deployments × €8K setup × 20% = €3,200
Total: €7,700 setup fees + €5,100 recurring by Month 6

## Next Steps

1. Apply to all 4 partner programs (Week 1 January)
2. Create integration playbooks while waiting for approval (Week 2-3 January)
3. Design partner program marketing page

## Success Metrics

* All 4 partner programs approved by February
* 5 tool deployments by March
* €5,000+ partner revenue by March

issues.title: [BIZ] Launch Industry-Specific AI Workshops for Czech Market
issues.description:
## Opportunity

Market research shows Czech businesses have 11-29% AI adoption but generic training dominates. Industry-specific workshops can command premium pricing (€249-€499 vs. €115 for generic).

## Market Gap

* Datascript: Generic 2-day workshops at €115/person
* No vertical-specific content
* No implementation pathway

## Target Industries (High Demand)

1. **Manufacturing** (Strong in CZ, 47% AI adoption in PL)
   * Quality control automation
   * Supply chain optimization
   * Predictive maintenance
2. **Financial Services** (40% adoption)
   * Risk assessment automation
   * Fraud detection
   * Customer service bots

## Pricing Model

* €299/person for industry workshop (4 hours)
* €2,500 corporate in-house (up to 10 people)
* €49 follow-up online course

## Estimated Impact

* Conservative: 10 workshops in Q1 = €2,950 revenue
* Realistic: 30 workshops in Q1 = €8,850 + 3 corporate = €7,500 = €16,350
* Aggressive: 50 workshops + 5 corporate = €29,450

## Next Steps

1. Create curriculum for Manufacturing workshop (highest ROI)
2. Create landing page for vertical workshops
3. LinkedIn outreach to manufacturing industry leaders
4. Run beta workshop with network contact
5. Document case study for marketing

## Success Metrics

* 10 workshop bookings by end of January
* 2 corporate clients by February
* €5,000+ revenue by March
